intro: Spergula tunetana, commonly known as the Tunisian spurge, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, which helps reduce water loss. Spergula tunetana is a perennial species that thrives in full sun and is often found in Mediterranean climates.
